Phil, assigning to you, since I think JSPUseBeanContentAssistProcessor should 
protect itself against this. (I think second time its happened?). 

Amy, I suspect there really is an image missing or not being found
... can you investigate that part? 

This is a pretty huge regression of a prime case ... so would like fixed for M5.

JDT introduced this bug with the 1.9 revision of CompletionProposalLabelProvider

They're assuming that proposal.getSignature() won't return null,
but CompletionProposal.getSignature() says that the default return value IS null
, and that's what we get when we use CompletionProposal#create(...).

We can work around this by setting a dummy signature:
   new char[]{Signature.C_UNRESOLVED};

on the proposal in JavaTypeNameRequestor#calculateImage(...)  

This probably isn't the optimal soltion though since the doc for
CompletionProposal states: 

"The completion engine creates instances of this class and sets
its properties; this method is not intended to be used by other clients."

JDT should probably allow for null signature for TYPE_REF.
Will open a bug.

In regards to the missing images comment in comment #2 it does not seem like 
there's really an image missing.

Verified in I20050630 content assist is working again.
